author: Staff Reporter
text:
Mani’s family members have voiced suspicion about the involvement of his friends in his death.

Investigators in the Kalabhavan Mani case on Saturday found bottles with chemical content from ‘Paddy,’ his farmhouse on the banks of the Chalakudy.

The bottles were found near the septic tank at the farmhouse. They were sent for chemical tests to find out if they contained the pesticide that was found in Mani’s viscera.

The police have taken into custody a person in connection with supplying hooch to ‘Paddy’. Another person, who allegedly brought the hooch to the farmhouse, has reportedly fled abroad.

Mani’s family members, including wife Nimmi, and brother R.L.V. Ramakrishnan, said they suspected the involvement of his friends and aides in his death.

Mr. Ramakrishnan said he feared that they had given him liquor, and said a murder case should be registered against those who were with the actor during his last moments.
title: Kerala police find chemical bottles at Kalabhavan Mani’s farmhouse
